description: Writing documentation, guides, tutorials, API docs, and specifications
principles: Documentation should be clear and easy to understand for the target audience
Information should be accurate and up-to-date
Structure should be logical with clear hierarchy
Examples should be concrete and copy-paste ready

input: Target audience identified (beginners, advanced users, etc.)
Scope of documentation (quick start, comprehensive guide, API reference)
Key concepts or sections to cover

qualityCriteria.completeness: All major topics covered, no obvious gaps, includes examples where helpful
qualityCriteria.correctness: Information is accurate and matches actual behavior/functionality
qualityCriteria.consistency: Terminology consistent, formatting consistent, tone consistent throughout
qualityCriteria.clarity: Easy to understand, explains concepts clearly, avoids jargon or explains it
qualityCriteria.performance: Well-organized for readability, scannable with headers, not overwhelming
qualityCriteria.maintainability: Easy to update, code examples are maintainable, clear structure for future additions

commonPatterns: Include table of contents for longer docs
Include a 'Getting Started' section if applicable
antiPatterns: Poor structure that's hard to navigate
Assuming too much or too little knowledge
No examples or only abstract examples
